data.title: What channel is the Cincinnati Reds game on? Here's how to watch the Reds all season long
data.meta_description: Here's where to watch and stream Cincinnati Reds games this season.
data.text:
Baseball fans, rejoice: The MLB is back.

The Cincinnati Reds and the rest of the league celebrated Opening Day on Thursday, taking on their first game of the 2024 season against the Washington Nationals.

As the Reds continue this season at Great American Ball Park and beyond, many fans will want to tune in from home. Here's how to watch and stream Reds games for the rest of the season.

What channel is the Reds game on?

Most Reds games air on Bally Sports Ohio, which is Channel 660 or Channel 661 (Bally Sports Cincinnati) on DirecTV for in-market fans.

Occasionally, Reds games will stream exclusively through Apple TV+ instead. Check the Reds schedule to see which platform is airing the game you'd like to watch. Get an Apple TV+ subscription, or start a free trial, here.

Where to stream Reds games

In-market fans can stream Reds games on the Bally Sports App through their cable TV provider, if Bally Sports Ohio is broadcasting that game. You can also stream these games through your TV provider on BallySports.com.

Watch games on the Bally Sports app on iPhones, iPads, Apple TV, Androids, Android TV, Chromecast, Roku, Xbox One, Windows phones and Amazon FireTV, Stick and Kindle Fire. The app is free to use, as long as you are a customer of a participating cable TV provider. Some participating TV providers include Spectrum, DirecTV, Cox, Fubo and Xfinity. See more on the list here.

How to stream Reds games out-of-market

Out-of-market fans can stream Reds games with an MLB.TV subscription.

How to listen to the Reds on the radio

Listen to Reds games in the Cincinnati area on 700 WLW and the Reds Radio Network.
